label: Descriptive List of Free Negroes Belonging to City Engine No. 9 [Copy 1]
description: List of volunteer firefighters of city engine number 9, including their names, ages, description, occupation, and residence. Donated to the Charleston Museum by Charles Pequette, 1925

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Descriptive List of Free Negroes Belonging to City Engine No. 9            No. Date of Enrollment Names Age Height Eyes Hair Complexion Occupation Residence Remarks   Sept 15th Alexander Pinceel 45 5 ft 1/2 Dark Short Brown Baker Coming st     Frances Hynes 38 5 ft 8 Black Short Black Wagoner America & Amherst     Henry Farr 22 4 ft 1/2 Blue Short Brown Bricklayer Wentworth near Rutledge     James F. Brown 38 5 ft 1/2 Dark Short Brown Tailor Ashley St. No. 70     James Ferguson 25 5 ft Black Short Brown Drayman Calhoun Est (east?) end     John Wadkins 22 5 ft 8  Dark Short Dark Drayman Henrietta St     John McCall 30 5 ft 1/2 Grey Black Brown Wheelwright King St     John B Turpin 25 5 ft 1/2 Black Short Black Labourer Duncan St. No. 20     Olander Gibbs 57 5 ft 8  Black Short Black Wagoner Warren near St. Phil     Paul F. Lopez 38 5 ft 8 Black Short Black Tailor Ratcliffe St. 20     Richard Jones 22 5 ft Grey Black Brown Tailor Reid near America
